Short Bio
Feb 19, 2020

I am a forth-year computer science PhD student in the Causal Artificial Intelligence Lab at Columbia University working with Prof. Elias Bareinboim. During my wonderful Master’s studies in Brown University, I was fortunate enough to work with Prof. Michael Littman. I obtained my B.S from Beihang University, under the supervision of Prof. Jingyuan Wang.

My research interest lies in the intersection of causal inference and reinforcement learning, especially in how to build reliable, generalizable and sample efficient agents.
